intro: Viscago vulgaris, commonly known as the common bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rosaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically reaches a height of 10–30 cm. The plant features slender, branched stems covered in fine hairs and produces small, white or pinkish flowers in clusters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a serrated margin. Viscago vulgaris is often found in grassy areas, along roadsides, and in disturbed soils, where it thrives in full sun to partial shade.
